ygData.subject: Escape
ygData.msgSnippet: Blast, he thought, they found me out! He ran to the hangar, hoping they hadn t had time to warn the sentries there. If they had not, he could still use his

Subject: Escape
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=225937926; y=tErBb6OvVWHtyeiOinCAQs9hpXbQoUr6kPcbFpn5_Kt5YguhrX5W
X-Yahoo-Profile: warriorazure

Blast, he thought, they found me out!

He ran to the hangar, hoping they hadn't had time to warn the sentries 
there. If they had not, he could still use his title to get out. If 
they had...

He skidded to a halt, his claws scratching imperceptibly at the metal 
floor. As he stopped, he adjusted his cape-like wingsand put on a 
dignified look on his face. He then went out, going for the small ship.

The two guards did not see alarmed. Good, he thought, or not.

- Ah, Councillor Azure, the first said, how are you?

- Fine, fine, Azure said. I've come to take a look at my ship. There 
was something amiss with the communication systems when I arrived, and 
I think the shield generator got knocked a bit.

- Well, it sure was a pretty rough flight, eh? That comet came closer 
than we'd have thought.

- Indeed. Now, if you'll excuse me...

- Go ahead, sir.

Azure laughed at them mentally. They hadn't been warned, and he was 
going to escape. He got in the small shuttle and started the engine.

- CommSys operational, he told the control. I'd like to take her for a 
small ride outside, see if there's anything else wrong with this bird.

- Roger that, Council 2, you're clear to go.

He thrusted the ship casually, not letting any of the emergency he 
felt transpire and make people notice. As he passed the doors, he let 
a sigh out.

- Now, turn back and get into the hangar again, Azure.

Azure turned, and saw her, pretty but unfortunatly his enemy.

- You know I won't do that, Balistica. You know I've finished what I 
came here for.

She held a blaster to the back of his head, ready to shoot.

- Don't make me do this, Councillor. The Maximals still need a 
powerful ally such as you. Don't make things worse, please...

- I am sorry...

He swiftly dropped a cryogrenade he had produced. The explosion was 
devastating, as it froze not only Balistica, but also the shuttle 
controls. The ship started going wild and it entered a wormhole. When 
it came out, it was freefalling in an atmosphere.

- What the...? Azure said. He started the mayday signal and braced 
himself for impact. The shuttle touched down in sea, but it did not 
sink. It skimmed over the waves like a car tumbling on a road at high 
speed, until it finally met a beach where it stopped.

Azure, stunned, made his way out of his seat. He saw what had happened 
to Balistica, and felt pity. She was demolished, but still alive. She 
was in stasis however, and he did not have anything to help her out

- I truly am sorry, my dear. They had been hiding this from me and I 
could not let it go as such. I will get you back, though. I swear it 
on my Predacon spark.

He left the battered ship and tried to look for anything out there.
